topic.title: ZeroNet Browser/Browser Extension?
topic.body:
Hello all, I'm new to ZeroNet, so pardon if this question has already been answered. I've tried Googling and searching on here, but can't find anything so far. 

I was thinking about one potential problem that I see for spreading ZeroNet is the accessibility of websites. Typing out extremely long public keys, or even simple .bit domain after 127.0.0.1 I think to some people might get annoying. 

Has anyone tried to simplify this by creating a browser extension that removes the localhost ip? Further more, would there be a way to realistically create a free DNS using a decentralized network that ultimately ran through a third party browser

The idea would be:

Third Party Browser (TPB) -> User inputs domain, ie (google.zero, google.randomdomainhere) -> TPB queries something like 127.0.0.1/long-public-key-pointing-to-DNS/place-where-DNS-lookup-is-performed -> if the domain has been registered in the free DNS, you are redirected to the localhost/public-key/ but what the user sees is the domain they typed.
